verses.roman:
jīva dīna ki karibe tāhāra varṇana?
śākhā-candra-nyāya kari' dig-daraśana

synonyms: jīva—a living entity; dīna—very poor; ki—what; karibe—will do; tāhāra—of that; varṇana—description; śākhā-candra-nyāya—the logic of showing the moon through the branches of a tree; kari'-I make; dik-daraśana—seeing the direction.
translation: What can a poor creature like me describe of those transformations? I can give only a hint of them, as if showing the moon through the branches of a tree.
